Description: Part of rim and neck of a black-figured pottery krater with broad ledge rim. Glaze variously fired. Interior glazed, though worn. Maeander band on top of rim, band of dots on outside. On neck, floral to left, probably flanking handle; griffin to right, head reversed, amid blobs as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis), Buried in sand the west wall of Temenos (inscribed in pencil: "Sand under west wall Diosk")
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked in pencil on inside: "Sand under west wall Diosk".
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 223, no. 98)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VI, no. 4)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 107, pl. XXXIV, no. 319.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.547)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4667 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
